forumNotes.content:
I was doing some research on booting from a thumb nail drive. It seems some computers can not boot from usb drives. Their bios does not support it.  

From my research there seems to be a couple of options.  

A u3 thumbnail OR grub4dos. Has anyone have any luck with these.  

If one was to use grub4dos; I think he would have to boot grub4dos from a CD before he could boot from the thumbnail.  

Would have to be able to boot from a 64 bit computer  

Would any other boot loaders work ?  

Has anyone done it using au3 thumbnail ?  

Any ideas on this ?

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
A quick *small* correction: a thumb***nail*** is a miniature picture a thumb***drive*** is a way to call USB Flash based mass storage devices, also "pendrives", "USB sticks", "Flash Drives", etc.: [http://www.msfn.org/...showtopic=98909](http://www.msfn.org/board/index.php?showtopic=98909 "External link") Two quick *major* corrections: * grub4dos has NOT an USB stack and won't help * a U3 stick won't help, as the problem is in the motherboard BIOS
The only way you can try is using PLoP: [http://www.plop.at/e...mngrusblog.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmngrusblog.html "External link") [http://www.plop.at/e...tmanagerdl.html](http://www.plop.at/en/bootmanagerdl.html "External link") Alone or in conjunction with grub4dos: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=6330](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=6330 "External link")
Or using a "kicker" either on hard disk or CD (only for some Operating Systems). Please post details on what you actually need/want to boot. A newish option, experimental and not for the "newbie" (no offence intended ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)) is using PLop on a network card extension ROM: [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=22553](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=22553 "External link") jaclaz P.S.: A typical thumbdrive: ![Posted Image](http://www.kahsoon.com/images/thumbdrive.jpg) :cool:
